t: 1 Chronicles 16
A Tent for the Ark
And*p they brought in the ark of God and placed it inside the tent which David had pitched for it, and they offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before God.
When David had finished offering the burnt offering and the peace offerings, he blessed the people in the name of the Lord.*s
He distributed to everyone of Israel, both man and woman, to everyone a loaf of bread and a portion of*i meat*i and a raisin cake.
He*p appointed some of the Levites as*i ministers before the ark of the Lord,*s even to celebrate and to thank and praise the Lord*s God of Israel:

Asaph the chief, and second to him Zechariah, then*i Jeiel, Shemiramoth, Jehiel, Mattithiah, Eliab, Benaiah, Obed-edom and Jeiel, with musical instruments, harps, lyres; also Asaph played*i loud-sounding cymbals,
and Benaiah and Jahaziel the priests blew*i trumpets continually before the ark of the covenant of God.
Then*p on that day David first assigned Asaph and his relatives to give thanks to the Lord.*s
Psalm of Thanksgiving
Oh*pn give thanks to the Lord,*s call upon His name; Make*ln known His deeds among the peoples.
Sing*ln to Him, sing praises to Him; Speak*ln of all His wonders.
Glory*ln in His holy name; Let*ln the heart of those who seek the Lord*s be glad.
Seek*ln the Lord*s and His strength; Seek*ln His face continually.
Remember*ln His wonderful deeds which He has done, His*ln marvels and the judgments from His mouth,
O*ln seed of Israel His servant, Sons*ln of Jacob, His chosen ones!
He*ln is the Lord*s our God; His*ln judgments are in all the earth.
Remember*ln His covenant forever, The*ln word which He commanded to a thousand generations,
The*iln covenant*i which He made with Abraham, And*ln His oath to Isaac.
He*ln also confirmed it to Jacob for a statute, To*ln Israel as an everlasting covenant,
Saying,*ln “To you I will give the land of Canaan, As*ln the portion of your inheritance.”
When*ln they were only a few in number, Very*ln few, and strangers in it,
And*ln they wandered about from nation to nation, And*ln from one*i kingdom to another people,
He*ln permitted no man to oppress them, And*ln He reproved kings for their sakes, saying,*i
“Do*ln not touch My anointed ones, And*ln do My prophets no harm.”
Sing*ln to the Lord,*s all the earth; Proclaim*ln good tidings of His salvation from day to day.
Tell*ln of His glory among the nations, His*ln wonderful deeds among all the peoples.
For*ln great is the Lord,*s and greatly to be praised; He*ln also is to be feared above all gods.
For*ln all the gods of the peoples are idols, But*ln the Lord*s made the heavens.
Splendor*ln and majesty are before Him, Strength*ln and joy are in His place.
Ascribe*ln to the Lord,*s O families of the peoples, Ascribe*ln to the Lord*s glory and strength.
Ascribe*ln to the Lord*s the glory due His name; Bring*ln an offering, and come before Him; Worship*ln the Lord*s in holy array.
Tremble*ln before Him, all the earth; Indeed,*ln the world is firmly established, it will not be moved.
Let*ln the heavens be glad, and let the earth rejoice; And*ln let them say among the nations, “The Lord*s reigns.”
Let*ln the sea roar, and all it contains; Let*ln the field exult, and all that is in it.
Then*ln the trees of the forest will sing for joy before the Lord;*s For*ln He is coming to judge the earth.
O*ln give thanks to the Lord,*s for He*i is*i good; For*ln His lovingkindness is everlasting.
Then*ln say, “Save us, O God of our salvation, And*ln gather us and deliver us from the nations, To*ln give thanks to Your holy name, And*ln glory in Your praise.”
Blessed*ln be the Lord,*s the God of Israel, From*ln everlasting even to everlasting. Then*p all the people said, “Amen,” and praised the Lord.*s
Worship before the Ark
So*p he left Asaph and his relatives there before the ark of the covenant of the Lord*s to minister before the ark continually, as every day’s work required;
and Obed-edom with his 68 relatives; Obed-edom, also the son of Jeduthun, and Hosah as gatekeepers.
He*i left*i Zadok the priest and his relatives the priests before the tabernacle of the Lord*s in the high place which was*i at Gibeon,
to offer burnt offerings to the Lord*s on the altar of burnt offering continually morning and evening, even according to all that is written in the law of the Lord,*s which He commanded Israel.
With them were*i Heman and Jeduthun, and the rest who were chosen, who were designated by name, to give thanks to the Lord,*s because His lovingkindness is everlasting.
And with them were*i Heman and Jeduthun with*i trumpets and cymbals for those who should sound aloud, and with*i instruments for*i the songs of God, and the sons of Jeduthun for the gate.
Then*p all the people departed each to his house, and David returned to bless his household.
